subject: Self Care
title: When Compassion Fatigue Blocks Self-Care
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: When Compassion Fatigue Blocks Self-Care.

hook.text: She spent all day caring for patients. At home, she had nothing left for herself. The helper was the one who needed help.

buildup.text: Compassion fatigue depletes the capacity for both other-compassion and self-compassion. Both wells dry up together.

discovery.text: Caregivers, parents, and helping professionals are at highest risk. Giving without replenishing guarantees depletion.

twist.text: Self-compassion is the antidote to compassion fatigue. It refills the well so you can keep giving without collapsing.

climax.text: If you care for others, schedule self-compassion like a medication. It's not optional. It's the tool that keeps you able.

punchline.text: Helpers need help too. Self-compassion refills the well.

quiz.question: Why are caregivers especially vulnerable to self-compassion deficits?
options: Constant giving without replenishing depletes both other and self compassion
